intro: Campanula rapunculus, commonly known as the bellflower or lesser bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland edges and meadows. Campanula rapunculus is often found growing in clusters and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
